title: Bless & Andy's Echoes of Wisdom Impressions

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom

transcript_chunks.text: uh I want to move on to some Zelda Echoes of wisdom impressions of course I reviewed this uh last week uh Tom with with Tom Marks exactly um I gave it a 8.5 out of 10 on the kind of funny scale um I know a couple of the people here are playing it Barrett blessing Andy have all at least started the game um bless I know you haven't played much real quick what what are your initial thoughts on this yeah I've only played I think the first hour of it uh it intrigues me here's my thing I am not not a top down Zelda person surprisingly probably to a lot of people right like I came up yeah Barett show shows up shaking his head right it's it's and it's not even a thing of me trying to resist top down Zelda it's always it's usually been a wrong place wrong time right like my first console growing up was in N64 and so like already I was in I was born in in the 3D era I was never a uh like handheld DS person or 3DS person and so I missed the ones that came out there so I always just came up with

was in N64 and so like already I was in I was born in in the 3D era I was never a uh like handheld DS person or 3DS person and so I missed the ones that came out there so I always just came up with 3D zeldas um picking up Echoes of wisdom I played it for a bit on stream on my computer monitor and I will be honest the first thing I noticed was the performance it was one of those things that shocked me because I I hadn't read the reviews or listen to many people talk about it I was kind of surprised I was like oh I got to a bit of a populated area and there were stutters where I was like oh man the switch is old the switch is an old uh uh device um but even getting past that right like I love the art style um I love looking at at this game just from a stylistic direction I think it looks really cute it reminds me of links Awakening in that way um I like how much they're focusing in on you know copying a item in the world and then replicating it and using that to solve problems in the

really cute it reminds me of links Awakening in that way um I like how much they're focusing in on you know copying a item in the world and then replicating it and using that to solve problems in the first hour it has been a an adjustment in my brain of oh there's an enemy I don't have a sword and so I guess I'm going to throw rocks at it oh wait I can spawn another enemy to then fight that enemy like it's Pokemon oh that's neat um but it has like I think for me had a bit of a slow start just trying to like wrap my mind around those things so far I'm not in a place where I'm like oh man I'm gonna keep going like going on with it just for the fact that I have a lot of games that I'm playing and you know trying to balance everything um I am intrigued but I don't know yeah how how much further I'm going to go with it at at this point at least Barrett how far are you in and what are you thinking so far uh right now I would say I'm like three hours in I just uh you know there's like kind

a game where you could kind of just problem solve however you want this feels like a perfect kind of melding of those two ways of thinking and designing a game where is it going to be a pure linear uh Zelda game or are we going to go with a hey this game this world is sort of just like a Sandbox you can do whatever the hell you want with whatever abilities you want I think so far I'm really really enjoying the melding of the two I do wish that this Ultra hand sort of uh comparative power that you have I wish you could rotate and and do more with it I don't love that you're just kind of stuck in that direction is the thing with that is I was with you and I said this in the review as well but as the game progresses I learn to appreciate it because that it becomes part of the design of not being able to do that like I feel like has creative puzzle solutions that you have to figure out of like being limited by that it's like how the hell am I going to get this up here like I'm just not on
